tit.cmt: 名取団→Natori-dan[玉造団は、"Tamatsukuri dan"と表記されておりますが、「名取団」は一つの軍団名なので、ハイフン付にて表記しました]

sen.j: 名取団（なとりだん）は、8世紀初めから10世紀まで日本の陸奥国（後の陸前国）名取郡に置かれた軍団 (古代日本)である。
sen.e: Natori-dan refers to Gundan (army corps in ancient Japan) deployed in Natori County, Mutsu Province (later Rikuzen Province), Japan from the early 8th century to the 10th century.

sen.j: 9世紀以降は胆沢城の鎮守府 (古代)の守備にあたった。
sen.e: After the ninth century, Natori-dan engaged in the defense of Chinju-fu (Pacification and Defense Headquarters in ancient times) of Isawa-jo Castle.

sen.j: 軍団制は大宝元年（701年）の大宝律令で実施された。
sen.e: A Gundan system was enforced under Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) established in 701.

sen.j: 初期の軍団の配置は不明だが、その当時陸奥国の国府が名取郡の郡山遺跡に所在したと推定されること、後述する2軍団時代に名取団が残された事からも、名取団が古くから置かれたと見るのが自然であろう。
sen.e: Although the deployment of initial Gundan is unknown, it is natural to consider that Natori-dan was deployed from old times because Kokufu (ancient provincial office/capital) of Mutsu Province was located at Koriyama Ruins in Natori County at that time, and Natori-dan remained in the era of two Gundan stated below.

sen.j: 8世紀は蝦夷との戦争が激化した時代で、軍団兵士も当然それに参加したが、個々の軍団の活動について知られることはない。
sen.e: Since the eighth century was the time when a war with Ezo (northerners) got more serious, soldiers in Gundan also participated in the war naturally, but activities of each Gundan was never known.

sen.j: 9世紀については、文屋綿麻呂によって征夷が一段落してからの沿革がわかる。
sen.e: Activities in the 9th century show a history after the subjection of indigenous inhabitants in eastern Japan was settled by FUNYA no Watamaro for the time being.

sen.j: まず、弘仁2年（811年）に陸奥国の軍団兵士は4000人から2000人に減らされ、玉造団と名取団に1000人ずつ計2000人を残すのみとなった。
sen.e: First of all, the number of soldiers in the Gundan of Mutsu Province was reduced from 4,000 to 2,000 in 811, and only 2,000 soldiers in total, 1,000 each for Tamatsukuri-dan (army corps in Tamatsukuri County, Mutsu Province) and Natori-dan, remained.

sen.j: しかし、弘仁6年（815年）8月に陸奥国は4団4000人を増員し、あわせて6団6000人から6交代制で常時1000人の軍団兵士を駐屯地に置いた。
sen.e: However, in August (old calendar) 815, Mutsu Province increased the number of troops and that of soldiers to 4 and 4,000, respectively, and always stationed 1,000 soldiers by having 6,000 soldiers in 6 troops in total work in 6 shifts.

sen.j: 名取団は北の玉造団・小田団とともに、胆沢城に500人と玉造柵に100人の守備兵を出したと推測される。
sen.e: It is estimated that Natori-dan dispatched 500 defensive soldiers to Isawa-jo Castle and 100 defensive soldiers to Tamatsukuri fortress, as well as Tamatsukuri-dan and Oda-dan in the north.

sen.j: これに符合して、胆沢城跡から出土した年代不明の漆紙文書に、柴田郡から徴発した人員の名簿がある。
sen.e: In concert with this, urushigami monjo (Lacquer documents) excavated from the site of Isawa-jo Castle for which the year of creation is unknown contained Myobo (identification) of personnel requisitioned from Shibata County.

sen.j: 柴田郡は地理的な関係から名取団に属したと推定できるので、名簿は胆沢城に駐屯した名取団のものと考えられる。
sen.e: Since it is presumable that Shibata County was covered by Natori-dan geographically, it is considered that Myobo was for the Natori-dan stationed at Isawa-jo Castle.

sen.j: 陸奥国の軍団は磐城団が増設されて7団7000人となり、承和10年（843年）に1000人を増員して7軍団に割りふった。
sen.e: The number of Gundan of Mutsu Province was increased to seven troops with 7,000 soldiers by adding Iwaki-dan, and soldiers were allotted to seven Gundan by increasing 1,000 soldiers in 843.

sen.e: Thereafter, on May 4, 869, Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) given to persons outside Kyoto) was granted to OSAKABE no Mototsugi of Natori-dan along with ABENOMUTSU no Nagamune, Gon no tairyo (Provisional Chief Administrative Officer) of Shibata County.

sen.j: 10世紀に編まれた延喜式にも陸奥国に7団を置くことが規定されているが、その活動を直接裏付けるような史料はない。
sen.e: The Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) compiled in the 10th century also specified the deployment of seven troops in Mutsu Province, but there are no historical materials to directly support the activities.

sen.j: 11世紀の前九年の役では軍団兵士の活動が見当たらず、この頃までに廃絶したかまったく形骸化したと考えられる。
sen.e: Since there were no materials showing the activities by soldiers in Gundan in the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) in the 11th century, it is considered that Natori-dan was abolished or lost substance completely before that time.
